p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane}ss In the District Court of the Fourth Judicial District holding terms at Spokane Falls Territory of Washington vs. Ray Raymond I Stanley Mattll being duly sworn on my oath depose and say that I am now and for the [ast nine years have been a resident of the precinct of Medical Lake in Spokane County Washington Territory. That have casual knowledge that there was such a case as that above named ever since the homicide out of which it grew. That I am well acquainted with the people residing in said Medical Lake precinct and have personal acquaintance with the greater part of many. That I have opportunity to hear the opinions and sentiments of the people of said precinct expresses and in a general way know the same. That I have never heard any expression of hostility to or prejudice against the said efendant Ray Raymond of the resident of said precinct. That if there was prejudice and ill will existing against her there I should have been most certain to have heard it. That from my best information the elleged facts relating to the homicide out of which said action drew are not generally known to the people of said precinct and that they generally have not formed an opinion as to the guilt or innocence of said defendant and that the people of said precinct are not prejudiced against said Ray Raymond in said action. Applicant further saith that there are about four hundred people living in said Medical Lake precinct and that applicant verily believes that a large number of hood unprejudiced and loyally qualified jurors can be summoned and secured in said precinct to serve as jurors in said action and further applicant saith not. Stanley Hallett Subscribed and sworn to before me this tenth day of December A.D. 1886 S.C. Hyde Notary Public
